page.shortlink: Open an .a5w page, static HTML page, URL, or PDF document, in a pop-up window or a DIV
page.topic: Open an .a5w page, static HTML page, URL, or PDF document, in a pop-up window or a DIV
page.description: Open a document (including .a5w pages, static .html pages, any other web page, e.g. www.google.com, or PDF document) in a modal, or modeless pop-up window, or in a DIV on the page.

section.description: Used with the Grid and UX component

item.name: Supercontrol?
item.description: Supercontrols include Google Maps, Yahoo Maps, MSN Maps, Google Search, Google Image and other pre-defined sites.

item.name: Supercontrol definition
item.description: Supercontrol definition property.

item.name: PDF document?
item.description: Specify if the document you want to display is a PDF document. Uncheck this property if you want to open a .a5w page, .html page, or other type of web document.

item.name: PDF filename
item.description: Specify the PDF filename. You can use field placeholders to reference a filename stored in a field in the current record. For example: {pdf_filename}.

item.name: PDF open parameters
item.description: Specify parameter to control how the PDF is displayed when it is intially rendered. You can set properties such as the zoom level. Not all PDF readers support these properties.

item.name: Page URL
item.description: Click the button to open the URL builder. TIP: The URL that you specify can use placeholders for field values. e.g. mypage.a5w?id={custId}. IMPORTANT: The data in the placeholders will be URL encoded. If you do not want to URL encode the data in a particular placeholder, enter the placeholder as {nourlencode:placeholderName}. For example: {nourlencode:field1}

item.name: Resolve field placeholders in URL from which part
item.description: (Applies only when your URL contains field name placeholders) Specify if the placedholders in the URL should be resolved by getting values from fields in the Grid part or the Detail View part. Choices include.

item.name: Target
item.description: Specify if the page should be opened in a pop-up window, a DIV on the page, or (if the Grid is running in a Tabbed UI) in a new Tabbed UI pane. (If you choose the 'Tabbed UI Pane' option, and the Grid is not running inside a Tabbed UI, it will be opened in a modeless pop-up window). Choices include.

item.name: Target Panel
item.description: Specify the Panel Id.

item.name: Parent Panel Navigator
item.description: Specify the Id of the parent Panel Navigator. The dynamic Panel will be added to this Panel Navigator.

item.name: Dynamic Panel Title
item.description: Specify the title for the Dynamic Panel.

item.name: User can close dynamic panel
item.description: (Only applies if the target Panel Navigator has been configured to use a Tab Band) Specify if the label for the dynamically added Panel has a 'close' icon that allows the user to close the dynmically added Panel.

item.name: Working message placement
item.description: Specify the panel where the wait message should be shown. You should chose a Panel that is currently visible, not a Panel that will be animated into view when the component is rendered.

item.name: Working message uses CSS3 animation?
item.description: Specify if the working message should be displayed using a CSS3 animation?

item.name: Working message animation size
item.description: Specify the size of the animation in pixels.

item.name: Browser window name
item.description: (Optional) Specify the window name. You can specify any arbitrary name. Useful if you want to refer to the window in some javascript code. You can also use special 'system' names. There are: '_self' - same frame, '_top' - whole page, '_blank' - new window and '_parent' - parent frame.

item.name: Browser window attributes
item.description: Browser window attributes property.

item.name: Target DIV ID
item.description: Specify the ID of the target DIV. This DIV can be in the component (for example, in a free-form edit region), or on the .a5w page that contains the component.

item.name: Can hide target DIV?
item.description: Specify the DIV can be hidden (to remove from view the target page after it has been opened in the DIV).

item.name: DIV hide hyperlink
item.description: Specify text for the hyperlink that hides the DIV where the target page is shown.

item.name: Target IFrame style
item.description: The target page will be opened in an IFrame inside the target DIV. Specify the inline style for the IFrame. You can set the IFrame's height and width in the style.

item.name: Window name
item.description: Set to <Default> to give the window a default name. If you give the window an explicit name (which must be unique), then you can easily get a pointer to the window to execute methods of the window object. Click the smart field for tips on how to name your window and for information on how to get a pointer to the window object.

item.name: Window type
item.description: Specify the window type. Popup windows will show in a moveable window on the page. Dropdown windows have no title bar and cannot be moded. By default, Dropdown windows open directly below the control that you click to open the window. Note: An Ajax window will NOT be blocked by a browser's internal protection against popup windows.

item.name: Sub-theme
item.description: (Optional) Specify a sub-theme for the window. The sub-theme can select a different pre-defined window 'look'. If you leave this property blank the 'base' sub-theme is automatically selected.

item.name: Dock window
item.description: Docked windows 'stick' to an edge of the screen and remain in place even when the page is scrolled.

item.name: Dock location
item.description: Specify which edge of the screen the window is docked to. Choices include *[ui:Left]*, *[ui:Right]*, *[ui:Top]*, *[ui:Bottom]*.

item.name: Window position
item.description: Specify where the window will be shown.

item.name: Re-use existing window
item.description: Specify if multiple modeless windows can be opened, or only a single modeless window.

item.name: Window title
item.description: Specify the window title. The window title can contain data from fields in the current record. Enclose field values in curly parens. e.g. Customer - {lastname}. To reference values from a column in a List control use this syntax: {LIST::ListName::ColumnName} (e.g. {LIST::MYLIST1::LASTNAME} )

item.name: Window title show
item.description: Specify if the window title should be shown or hidden.

item.name: Window title position
item.description: Specify if the window title should appear at the top or bottom of the window. Choices include *[ui:Top]*, *[ui:Bottom]*.

item.name: Window title direction
item.description: Specify if the direction is 'ltr' (left-to-right) (title on left, close button on right) or 'rtl' (right-to-left) (close button on left and title on right). Choices include *[ui:ltr]*, *[ui:rtl]*.

item.name: Window title has close button
item.description: Specify if the window title has a Close button.

item.name: Disable window move
item.description: Specify if the window cannot be moved by the user.

item.name: Pane title
item.description: Specify the tab pane title. The pane title can contain data from fields in the current record. Enclose field values in curly parens. e.g. Customer - {lastname}. To reference values from a column in a List control use this syntax: {LIST::ListName::ColumnName} (e.g. {LIST::MYLIST1::LASTNAME} )

item.name: Window height
item.description: Specify the window height. Use CSS syntax. For example: 3in, 10cm, 200px. If you do not set the height, the window will resize automatically to accommodate the window contents.

item.name: Window width
item.description: Specify the window height. Use CSS syntax. For example: 3in, 10cm, 200px. If you do not set the width, the window will resize automatically to accommodate the window contents.

item.name: Window is resizable
item.description: Specify if the window is resizable.

item.name: Working message
item.description: Specify the text of the message to show in the window while the window waits for its contents to be generated.

item.name: Working message icon
item.description: Specify the image to show in the window while the window waits for its contents to be generated.

item.name: Refresh Grid on window close
item.description: When the window is closed, specify if the Grid should be refreshed. You can refresh the current row, or all rows in the Grid. Choices include.

item.name: Has pointer icon
item.description: Specify if the window has a pointer icon that points to the element that was clicked to show the window.

item.name: Pointer position
item.description: Specify the window edge that has the pointer icon. If you select 'Auto' the most appropriate edge is automatically selected. Choices include *[ui:Auto]*, *[ui:Top]*, *[ui:Bottom]*, *[ui:Left]*, *[ui:Right]*.

item.name: Animation
item.description: Specify if the window should be animated when it is shown or hidden. Note: If the window contains an IFrame, which in turn contains a PDF viewer, animation may not work well and should not be used.

item.name: Show animation style
item.description: Select the animation method to use when the window is shown. Fade and Slide use methods in jQuery core. Other options require jQueryUI. Choices include *[ui:None]*, *[ui:Fade]*, *[ui:Slide]*, *[ui:Blind]*, *[ui:Clip]*, *[ui:Drop]*, *[ui:Explode]*, *[ui:Fold]*, *[ui:Puff]*, *[ui:Scale]*, *[ui:Size]*, *[ui:Pulsate]*.

item.name: Show animation speed
item.description: Specify the animation speed. You can select a pre-defined option (slow = 600 milliseconds, fast = 200 milliseconds), or you can enter an explicit value in milliseconds.

item.name: Hide animation style
item.description: Select the animation method to use when the window is closed. Fade and Slide use methods in jQuery core. Other options require jQueryUI. Choices include *[ui:None]*, *[ui:Fade]*, *[ui:Slide]*, *[ui:Blind]*, *[ui:Clip]*, *[ui:Drop]*, *[ui:Explode]*, *[ui:Fold]*, *[ui:Puff]*, *[ui:Scale]*, *[ui:Size]*, *[ui:Pulsate]*.

item.name: Hide animation speed
item.description: Specify the animation speed. You can select a pre-defined option (slow = 600 milliseconds, fast = 200 milliseconds), or you can enter an explicit value in milliseconds.

item.name: Has custom toolbar buttons
item.description: Specify if the window has custom buttons in the window toolbar (at the bottom of the window).

item.name: Define buttons
item.description: Define the buttons that appear in the window toolbar (at the bottom of the window).

item.name: Buttons in-line style
item.description: In-line style for the buttons. TIP: To display the buttons left justified, enter an in-line style of: text-align:left;

item.name: Show top bar
item.description: Specify if a top bar should be shown. (Shows above the window body, but inside the body container).

item.name: Top bar HTML
item.description: Specify the HTML to show in the top bar.

item.name: Top bar style
item.description: Specify the in-line style for the top bar.

item.name: Show bottom bar
item.description: Specify if a top bar should be shown. (Shows below the body, inside the body container).

item.name: Bottom bar HTML
item.description: Specify the HTML to show in the top bar.

item.name: Bottom bar style
item.description: Specify the in-line style for the top bar.

item.name: Show header
item.description: Specify if a header should be shown. (Shows above the window body, but inside the body container).

item.name: Header HTML
item.description: Specify the HTML to show in the header.

item.name: Header style
item.description: Specify the in-line style for the top bar.

item.name: Show footer
item.description: Specify if a footer should be shown. (Displays below the body, the bottom bar and below any user-defined buttons).

item.name: Footer HTML
item.description: Specify the HTML to show in the footer.

item.name: Footer style
item.description: Specify the in-line style for the footer.

item.name: onInitialize
item.description: Specify the Javascript code to execute the first time the window is shown.

item.name: onBeforeShow
item.description: Specify the Javascript code to execute before the window is shown.

item.name: onShow
item.description: Specify the Javascript code to execute when the window is shown.

item.name: onBeforeHide
item.description: Specify the Javascript code to execute before the window is hidden.

item.name: onHide
item.description: Specify the Javascript code to execute when the window is hidden.

item.name: onFocus
item.description: Specify the Javascript code to execute when the window gets focus.

item.name: onMove
item.description: Specify the Javascript code to execute when the window is moved.

item.name: onResize
item.description: Specify the Javascript code to execute when the window is resized.

videos.title: Opening an .a5w Page in a new 'Browser Window'
videos.description: When opening an .a5w page in a Browser Window, there are several options for defining how the browser window is opened: on the current page, in a new tab, or in a new window. This video explains the options available when opening an .a5w page in a Browser Window.
